DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effectiveness identify stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) female subject use Induced Reflex Cough Test ( IRCT ) administer urodynamic test evaluation sensitivity specificity .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Effectiveness Induced Reflex Cough Test Plus Urodynamics Identify Stress Urinary Incontinence Female Subjects With History Stress Urinary Incontinence
DOC.criteria: Women > 25 year age History SUI ( except healthy control ) Healthy stable medical problem ( change 3 month ) Willingness ability undergo study procedure Stable medication allow except prescription overthecounter medication anticholinergic Î±agonistic property affect bladder urethra ; must discontinue least 2 week prior evaluation Able understand sign inform consent document . Body mass index ( BMI ) > 40 History severe arthritis hip , knee , foot could limit mobility study Prior treatment kind ( surgical pharmacologic ) incontinence least 30 day cough test session include treatment sling , botox , interstim bulking agent Prior pelvic radiation Postvoid residual urine > 100 mL screen Pelvic Organ Prolapse Quantification ( POPQ ) stage > 2 Positive urine culture screen dip stick > 1+ leukocyte esterase day procedure Positive pregnancy test Evidence infection hepatitis human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) Dementia Clinically significant change electrocardiogram ( ECG ) woman > 50 year age clinical laboratory value determine investigator History urge symptom , diagnosis interstitial cystitis , irritable bowel disease ( require medication ) History neurological deficit injury could affect laryngeal cough reflex , example , central nervous system related condition stroke multiple sclerosis , head neck cancer , major laryngeal surgery History neurological disorder lead bladder abnormality include stroke , Parkinsonism , multiple sclerosis , spinal cord surgery spinal cord injury Active hemorrhoid history recent ( within 1 year ) rectal surgery Previous major pelvic abdominal surgery ( within 6 month ) Tobacco smoker nonsmoker > 15 packyear history frequent ( > 2 time per week ) marijuana smoke Active sexually transmit disease genital herpes outbreak symptomatic pelvic inflammatory disease Pessary place
